stimulusHtml: Which of the following makes a correct claim about whether sound waves are transverse or longitudinal waves, and also provides a valid justification for the claim?
choicesHtml: Sound waves are transverse waves. They transfer energy between locations.
Sound waves are transverse waves. Particles in the medium move perpendicular to the direction of wave propagation.
Sound waves are longitudinal waves. They do not transfer energy between locations.
Sound waves are longitudinal waves. Particles in the medium move parallel to the direction of wave propagation.
